title: Guidelines for Human-AI Interaction
keyPoints: 18 design guidelines for human-AI interaction across initial, during, when wrong, and over time phases
keyHypotheses: Well-designed AI interactions follow consistent patterns that can be codified
strengths: Large-scale analysis of 150+ AI products; actionable guidelines
weaknesses: Guidelines are general, not research-task specific
notes: Foundational work - our study extends these guidelines to research collaboration

title: Beyond Accuracy: The Role of Mental Models in Human-AI Team Performance
keyPoints: Human mental models of AI capabilities significantly affect team performance; accurate mental models improve outcomes beyond AI accuracy alone
keyHypotheses: Understanding AI capabilities is as important as AI accuracy for effective collaboration
strengths: Rigorous experimental design; clear causal claims
notes: Supports our hypothesis about dynamic role allocation requiring mutual understanding

title: Principles of Mixed-Initiative User Interfaces
keyPoints: 12 principles for mixed-initiative interaction including uncertainty handling, graceful degradation, and memory of user patterns
keyHypotheses: Effective human-AI systems require dynamic sharing of control based on context
weaknesses: Pre-modern AI; principles need updating for LLMs
notes: Theoretical foundation for dynamic role allocation - still highly relevant

title: Human-AI Collaboration in Data Science: Exploring Data Scientists' Perceptions of Automated AI
keyPoints: Data scientists view AI as collaborator not replacement; trust develops through transparent explanations
keyHypotheses: Domain expertise affects how users perceive and use AI assistance
notes: To read - relevant for understanding research-specific collaboration patterns

title: The Future of Human-AI Collaboration: A Taxonomy of Design Knowledge for Hybrid Intelligence Systems
keyPoints: Taxonomy of human-AI collaboration patterns; framework for designing hybrid intelligence systems
keyHypotheses: Human-AI collaboration can be systematically categorized and designed
notes: To read - may inform our experimental conditions
